content.raw:
I tested the compilation on my computer, and I found that compiling `EntityManagement_TEST.cc` alone increased from 42s \(on `default`\) to 52s \(on this branch\) while using single-threaded compilation.

It’s very true that our current use of templates for specifying desired features will result in long compilation times for consumers. I have a plan to fix this using [explicit template instantiation](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2351148/explicit-instantiation-when-is-it-used), so that standard feature sets would not need to be recompiled by end-users \(they’ll only have long compilation times if they want highly customized sets of features\). I’ve been punting on this for now since our feature sets are still relatively small, but if your docker’s long compilation time is being caused by the templates, then I could move up explicit instantiation on my todo list.
